description: 近年來無論在社區營造或地方創生領域，透過設計翻轉地方已成為國內外政府及民間部門重要的實踐手法，社會大眾對於設計師之期待也不同於以往，除視覺美感外，也期望對地方經濟及社會層面有積極作為。本課程擬介紹社區營造與地方創生之基本學理，輔以國內外案例分析，並帶領學生走入地方，以參與式設計方法來處理真實世界中場域活化議題，培養學生對場域問題的觀察與分析能力，也鍛鍊以設計解決問題之能力。In recent years, whether in the field of communication empowerment or placemaking, transforming places through design has become an important method for domestic and foreign governments and private sectors. The public’s expectations for designers are also different from the past. In addition to visual aesthetics, designers are also expected to make positive contributions to the local economy and society. This course intends to introduce the basic theories of community empowerment and placemaking, supplemented by case analysis around the world. The course will take students into places to use participatory design to deal with real-world placemaking issues. The course will enhance students' ability to observe and analyze field problems, and also exercise their ability to solve problems through design.
prerequisites: 具備空間電腦繪圖及設計基礎能力

syllabus.zh:
1.社區營造與地方創生
2.參與式設計方法
3.地方議題探索：觀光、特產與地方品牌
4.地方議題探索：食農、生態與永續
5.地方發展願景與議題確認
6.田野調查操作
7.場域方案企劃與提案
8.場域策展與交流
syllabus.en:
1.Community empowerment and placemaking
2.Participatory design
3.Exploring local issues: Tourism, specialty and local brand
4.Exploring local issues: Agri-food, ecology and sustainability
5.Local development vision and issue identification
6.Fieldwork
7.Project planning and proposals
8.Curation and Communication

referenceBooks:
1.山崎亮著、莊雅琇譯，2018，社區設計的時代：用「不造物的設計」概念打造二十一世紀理想社會，全面探索社區設計的工作奧義、設計總體方針，以及如何與社群團體培養合作默契，台北市：臉譜、城邦文化。
2.王本壯等著，2014，落地生根：台灣社區營造的理論與實踐，台北市：唐山。
